place.name: SPORLE
place.gazetteerText: SPORLE-WITH-PALGRAVE, a parish in Swaffham district, Norfolk; on the East Anglian railway, 2¼ miles-NE of Swaffham. It has a post-office, of the name of Sporle, under Swaffham. Acres, 3,817. Real property, £6,678. Pop., 806. Houses, 186. The manor belongs to St. Katherine's Hospital,, London. An alien black priory was founded here in the time of Henry II.; was given, by Henry VI., to Eton College; and has left some vestiges. The living is a vicarage and a rectory in the diocese of Norwich. Value, £300. Patron, Eton College. The church is early English. There are a Primitive Methodist chapel, an endowed school with £32 a year, and charities £90. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
